description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3f3bk","text":"This protocol includes the expression and lyophilization of the β-Galactosidase enzyme (from the LacZ gene) in a cell-free system. We used it to prepare and conduct experiments for a biochemistry lab course. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eun15","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3j6vl","text":"The cell-free extracts and buffers were prepared according to:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":62}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hj84","text":"Guzman-Chavez, F., Arce, A., Adhikari, A., Vadhin, S., Pedroza-Garcia, J. Constructing Cell-Free Expression Systems for Low-Cost Access.ACS synthetic biology,11(3), 1114–1128. https://doi.org/10.1021/acssynbio.1c00342","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":251,"length":21},{"style":"italic","offset":273,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t6pc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nkr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nqrq","text":"The lyophilization steps for cell-free systems were adapted from:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":65}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tqu3","text":"Jung, J. Cell-free biosensors for rapid detection of water contaminants.Nature Biotechnology,38(12), 1451-1459.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":179,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":200,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Incubate   at   in an orbital shaker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":32,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"931kb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bvfv8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5unmu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"elgjf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"8E4688C00C6911ED92203BBE4795B58B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CB6F6CD00C6911ED92203BBE4795B58B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"230","start":null,"temperature":"37","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":208,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"8pokk","text":"We have seen that shaking improves the reaction efficiency. To ensure optimal stir, we put the 0,6 or 1,5 mL tubes in an Erlenmeyer flask, cover the flask with aluminium foil and put it in the orbital shaker.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"3":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":22,"style":"bold"}],"key":"6ueje","text":"After incubation, the control tubes should look similar to this:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"emv09","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ar7h2","text":" ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"EF87BC300C5F11EDA6BA6BE8AF4ACCB6","height":171.66545454545474,"id":362924,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"20c92","text":"The tubes should have a yellow color that will only turn to purple in the case of the positive control, as the beta-galactosidase catalyzes a reaction that cleaves CPRG into galactose and chlorophenol red.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"61412.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mcpqbmtz7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mcpnbmtz7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mcppbmtz7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mcpmbmtz7.webp","width":257.96721311475443},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3b5s","text":"Prepare the CFE reactions for lyophilization by diluting   of the reaction in PBS 1X to a final volume of   (1/12.5 dilution).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":78,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":106,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":57,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":106,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"19CF03500C6911EDA6BA6BE8AF4ACCB6","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2500","error":false,"guid":"1C01E8E00C6911EDA6BA6BE8AF4ACCB6","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"df5eq","text":"Vortex and make   aliquots. Seal each tube with aluminum foil or parafilm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5lsvf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2d1fk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"1DCA9AF00C6911EDA6BA6BE8AF4ACCB6","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":136,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":11,"style":"bold"},{"length":1,"offset":16,"style":"bold"},{"length":11,"offset":30,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8odf0","text":"This should take approximately 50 tubes. The sealing is done to prevent the small pellets from “jumping” out of the tubes under vacuum.  ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"69dj7","text":"Place the tubes at   for 20-30 min to allow slow freezing. .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a7dhg","text":" our case, our freeze-dryer allows us to set a condenser temperature of   and 0,04 mBar of pressure.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8pl7c","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"913o7","text":"We place the tubes at this setting for 60 mins, then turn OFF the vacuum pump and let the vacuum and temperature slowly rise for 60 minutes before removing the tubes from the drying {"blocks":[{"key":"au8l5","text":"Remove the tubes from the drying chamber, quickly remove the parafilm and close the tubes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a7g8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"10e3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1n70l","text":"It is very important that this step is carried out quickly and with gloves, to avoid any cross-contamination that may affect subsequent steps","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"55l3v","text":"Unless rehydrated immediately, place the tubes in a light protective bag with a silica gel desiccant, an oxygen absorber and a shot of argon using an argon canister to achieve an anoxic environment. Vacuum seal the bag using a vacuum sealer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":199,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6l5m2","text":"To rehydrate the lyophilized enzyme (seen as a white pellet on the tube), spin down and add   of PBS 1X. Vortex for   to favor the homogeneous resuspension of the protein inside the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":92,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":92,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":116,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"78ok9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fr610","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55n4i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"DCAC44500C6911ED92203BBE4795B58B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":40,"guid":"DED2A6C00C6911ED92203BBE4795B58B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bg8dk","text":"This should make a final 1/250 dilution from the original CFE reaction expressing β-Galactosidase, bringing the solution to a concentration we can use in these experiments. ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"65g9l","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":188,"style":"bold"}],"key":"sm8","text":"To determine the ideal concentration of enzyme necessary for our experiments, we realized an enzyme assay with different concentrations of β-Galactosidase (and a constant concentration of CPRG). We chose the highest enzyme dilution that showed a colorimetric change from yellow to red/purple after incubating the tubes at 37°C for 15 minutes.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ij21","text":"Store the bags protected from light at   or RT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ce235","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"C88237F00C6911ED92203BBE4795B58B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6jdoh","text":"Perform small punctures in the seal of each tube using a small 1mL syringe or a similar instrument. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
